pt: {sc}calm{/sc} {sc}tranquil{/sc} {sc}serene{/sc} {sc}placid{/sc} {sc}peaceful{/sc} mean quiet and free from disturbance. {sc}calm{/sc} often implies a contrast with a foregoing or nearby state of agitation or violence.

pt.t: the protests ended, and the streets were {it}calm{/it} again

pt: {sc}tranquil{/sc} suggests a very deep quietude or composure.

pt.t: the {it}tranquil{/it} beauty of a formal garden

pt: {sc}serene{/sc} stresses an unclouded and lofty tranquility.

pt.t: watched the sunset of a {it}serene{/it} summer's evening

pt: {sc}placid{/sc} suggests an undisturbed appearance and often implies a degree of complacency.
{sc}peaceful{/sc} implies a state of repose in contrast with or following strife or turmoil.

shortdef: free from agitation, excitement, or disturbance
